items.title: Live: Property losses feared in Otways fire as Victoria breaks its all-time temperature record
items.description: A record-breaking heatwave is impacting south-east Australia, with temperatures expected to soar in parts of Victoria, South Australia and New South Wales. Follow our live coverage.

items.title: Sepp Blatter supports boycott of men's World Cup games in US
items.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of men's World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Donald Trump and his administration.

items.title: Trump triggers a gold rush as investors flee the US
items.description: While the surging gold price has been a surprise, the driving forces behind it are not. Investors are losing faith in the United States and its role as the standard-bearer for global capitalism.

items.title: Trump has always been the master of the story, but he's losing control of the narrative
items.description: If there was one policy area that was at the centre of US President Donald Trump's election win in 2024, it was immigration policy. But it has now become mired in controversy.

items.title: Device allegedly thrown into Invasion Day crowd designed to 'explode on impact', say police
items.description: A 31-year-old man is charged with making explosives in suspicious circumstances after a device was allegedly thrown into a crowd of hundreds of people attending an Invasion Day rally in central Perth yesterday.

items.title: Man denied bail over 'reprehensible' speech at March for Australia rally
items.description: Brandan Koschel has been charged with publicly inciting hatred on the grounds of race causing fear after he made comments at an open mic session at the rally.

items.title: Live: Australian share market rallies to three-month high
items.description: The ASX 200 has held onto its gains through the session, trading higher as gold and silver surge in price. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Live: Ley backer insists leadership speculation 'all sound and fury signifying nothing'
items.description: A backer of Sussan Ley has taken aim at the fevered speculation about a looming Liberal leadership challenge, dismissing it as "sound and fury signifying nothing". Follow live.

items.title: Live: Zverev battles into Australian Open semifinal, heat rules in effect
items.description: Near record temperatures are forecast for day 10 of the Australian Open, featuring the start of the singles quarterfinals, with Alex de Minaur and top seed Carlos Alcaraz the main event. Follow live.

items.title: Two arrested for allegedly trying to import 65kg of heroin through airport
items.description: Police allege officers found an estimated 65 kilograms of white powder, which returned a positive result for heroin.

items.title: Two people die in light plane crash near private Gold Coast airstrip
items.description: Police say the plane crashed shortly after take-off from the private airstrip, killing two men and sparking a large fire.

items.title: Second rock fisherman's body recovered on NSW South Coast in 48 hours
items.description: A second body has been located during the search for two missing rock fishermen on the South Coast, after police received a missing persons report on Monday.

items.title: Government agency deliberately broke law for years, federal watchdog finds
items.description: Services Australia has known it was not fully complying with new child support laws since 2019, according to a scathing report released by the Commonwealth Ombudsman.

items.title: China is so angry with Japan, all the pandas are now gone
items.description: The departure of the last pandas from Japan demonstrates a significant crisis in North-East Asian politics that has no resolution on the horizon.

items.title: Kanye West says he 'lost touch with reality' due to brain injury
items.description: Ye, the artist formerly known as Kanye West, has taken out a full-page ad in the Wall Street Journal to apologise for past behaviour, saying he had an undiagnosed brain injury and bipolar disorder.

items.title: Divers come within metres of great white as local sightings grow
items.description: The sighting comes amid a spate of white shark reports in SA's south east, and after a tragic month of incidents in NSW.

items.title: Does your pet really need to be left inside on a hot summer's day with the air con on?
items.description: Do you wonder what your pet gets up to at home when you're not there? With temperatures on the rise, we asked three experts about keeping them cool in the heat.

items.title: The Godmother of Punk and the 'inventor' of black honoured in new exhibition
items.description: The revolutionary work of fashion designers Vivienne Westwood and Rei Kawakubo is celebrated with style, surprise and punk flair in this new exhibition.

items.title: Shared cooking and child care: The benefits of multi-generational living
items.description: Cost-of-living and housing affordability issues are bringing generations together under the same roof, but some families are doing it by choice.

items.title: NT government mandates schoolkids sing two verses of Australian anthem
items.description: Under a policy introduced today, Northern Territory public schools will be directed to play both verses of the anthem during school assemblies and special events.

items.title: Abalone trafficking charges against Indigenous men dropped
items.description: Seven Aboriginal men from the NSW South Coast, accused of illegally trafficking thousands of blacklip abalone, walk free after police prosecutors withdraw all charges.

items.title: Residents of Einasleigh in Far North Queensland evacuate amid flooding
items.description: Etheridge Shire Council in Far North Queensland issues an Emergency Warning for Einasleigh township residents to evacuate.

items.title: Major winter storm kills dozens of people across the US
items.description: Almost 200 million Americans are under cold weather alerts as snow, sleet and freezing rain affects swathes of the country from Texas to New England, with temperatures set to fall dangerously low this week.

items.title: Man faces court for allegedly importing 'potent' drug via mail from UK
items.description: Nowra man Joshua Stephen Davey faces court after an investigation into "small round blue pills" allegedly found by Border Force in a package being sent to the South Coast from the UK.

items.title: Texas police urge 'wanted' Australian to hand himself in as sightings reported
items.description: Texan authorities say an extradition order may be required to resolve the "legal limbo" involving Australian man Izaak Michell.
